meanings.definition: relating to the measurement of time
meanings.sent1: The horologic study of sundials fascinated the students.
meanings.sent2: She admired the horologic precision of the old grandfather clock.
meanings.sent3: The horologic expert could always tell the time without looking at a clock.
meanings.sent4: His horologic skills were so sharp, he could estimate the time accurately just by observing the sun's position.
meanings.sent5: The horologic nature of the hourglass made it a reliable timekeeper.

meanings.definition: a device for measuring time, such as a clock or watch
meanings.sent1: The antique shop displayed various horologics from different eras.
meanings.sent2: He treasured his collection of horologics, each with its unique history.
meanings.sent3: The horologic on the wall chimed every hour, reminding everyone of the time.
meanings.sent4: The intricate design of the horologic made it a beautiful addition to the room.
meanings.sent5: The horologic ticked away, marking the passage of each moment with precision.
